description: This 308 GT/4 comes to us from Texas after long term storage.  It went directly into our workshop where it received a major service.  Included in the service was the full cam belt replacement, full valve adjustment with cam seal replacements, 4 carburetor rebuild and a major air conditioning service.  Along with a full lubrication service, the brakes were also serviced with rebuilt calipers and new brake pads.  Today the car runs and drives extremely tight with the fantastic handling that you get with a well sorted 308 GT/4.  These Bertone beauties have gone up in value due to the rarity and the pleasure that they are to drive.

1975 Ferrari 308 GT4 Dino, Red with tan leather. One owner last 30 years. Recent major service: cam shaft belts, tensioners and seals, overhauled distributors and carbs, many punch list items, dino tuned. 30 years of maintenance records. Excellent condition, needs nothing.

This California Ferrari features the carbureted engine and has only logged 43,191 miles. The major service was just completed including the belts, hoses, fuel lines, water pump etc. This outstanding example is ready to go. This also has the factory upgraded 16 inch wheels.

Motorcar Studio is pleased to offer this 1975 Ferrari (Dino) 308GT4. Silver/Boxer over black and blue interior. 69k miles. A very original and honest car with a known long-term ownership history and good service records. With the same North Carolina owner from 1988 until 2011 (it was a birthday gift from his wife) and then with a collector in Atlanta until our acquisition earlier this year.

We just completed a belt service with Hill Engineering bearings and fitted a new set of Vredestein Sprint Classics on the original Campagnolo wheels. We also serviced the A/C and it is currently blowing cold. Runs, drives and sounds great (see video) -- there really is no substitute for a carbureted Ferrari and this one feels well sorted and put together.

We believe the paint to be mostly original (the silver at least) and in presentable condition -- there are a few flaws and some light checking on the top sides but it looks too good to warrant a repaint. Likewise the interior presents well with only minor wear on the outer driver bolster. Engine is dry, gearbox feels good (even second gear) and it's tidy underneath. Owner's manual and tools are included. Aside from the mirrors, Vitaloni units likely installed in period, the car is all stock and unmolested with the early Dino details intact. A great driver that has been well cared for and offered at an approachable price point.
For more information on this 1975 Ferrari 308 GT4 for sale at Motorcar Studio in Atlanta, please call 404-692-5250.

This 308 is very special in that it is unrestored with original paint and documented with two owners and low miles. Massive binder with its records and history including original tools and manual book. Recently it has had a fresh belt service. It runs and drives exceptionally well and has the best shifting gearbox of any 308 I have driven. The weber carbs are beautifully balanced. They start, idle, and run well in any RPM range. The oil pressure is exceptional and the clutch is exactly how you would expect it to be.  A car only gets to be original once and a carburetted Ferrari is a special breed indeed. Please call Casey at (614) 832-8728 for a full review.

Gateway Classic Cars  Orlando Florida  showroom is proud to present this 1977 Ferrari 208 Coupe for sale. Introduced at the Geneva Motor Show in 1975 the 208 GT4 was a low-displacement version of the V8 produced for the Italian market where cars with engines larger than two litres were subjected to a doubled VAT (38%). The engine was de-bored to (66.8x71 mm) 2.0 L (1991 cc) V8 resulting in the smallest production V8 in history for a road car.Power output is 170 PS (125 kW) at 7700 rpm for a top speed of 137 mph (220 km/h). Smaller Weber 34 DCNF carburetors a lower final drive ratio and skinnier tires completed the technical changes for the 208. Chrome (rather than black) accents outside and the lack of fog lights were external visual indicators of the smaller-engined GT4. Inside the 208 GT4 featured a black rather than silver dash facing. If you are truly looking for a rare and collectible Ferrari call now before some collector scoops it up. This 1977 Ferrari 208 can be seen including an HD video at www.gatewayclassiccars.com call at 407-771-2000 or Email

for more information. See more at : http://www.gatewayclassiccars.com/orlando/1977/ferrari/208-S933.html

Always a California car, this 308 has had a very kind life in perfect weather with good service. As a long time collector myself, my first judgement on Ferraris is how nice are the seats; they tell you a lot about its previous life.. These are, of course, very nice and fitting for a car that has had love.

This car has traveled 34,850 miles and includes service receipts of the last two major services as well as the original manuals. The belts are fresh as of this year, so you will feel peace of mind as a new owner. The car still retains its smog pump and equipment which is often absent on these cars and important to have. The car looks to have had one very fine repaint in its life and you can tell from the pictures the quality of that work. Even the stereo sounds good in this 308 as it has had very tasteful speaker boxes added that are upholstered in matching interior fabric. Ferrari 308's are now at a value range that it is even more important to buy the right example. As as individual with a great deal of experience with these cars, this example is one that I would not hesitate to put in my garage for long term enjoyment.

Every first time buyer wants a red Ferrari. However, speaking from personal experience it is the one who puts a black over tan Ferrari in their garage that simply wants the finest car to enjoy driving only for the sake of their personal appreciation. A statement in itself.
Call Casey at (614) 832-8728 for a full review

European Motor Studio is proud to offer this beautiful 1985 Ferrari 400i Coupe finished in Grigio Metallic over Tan leather. This 400i was delivered new to its first owner on April 9, 1985 and sold by Walnut Creek Ferrari INC in California. The car remained in the Bay area until moving to Palm Springs with the second owner in 2007 where it has been ever since. The original Grigio Metallic paint still shows very nicely with a very nice shine and luster. There are a few stone chips in the front nose and a couple small hairline cracks that has started in the edged by the headlights and hood lines. There is one area on the passenger fender that looks as if something has stained the paint (pictured). All of the exterior glass appears to be original even the front windshield with its original 400i specs. The interior of the car is all original and in lovely patina'd condition. The driver seat does show creasing but absolutely no tears or damage. The leather is still very soft and supple with no dye work. All of the carpets and dash are all original and show very well with no damage or excessive wear (The automatic gearbox selector guide trim piece has been replaced since the pics). This 400i starts right up and idles with ease and does not smoke under start up or acceleration. The car pulls smoothly and strong through all of the RPM range and shifts smoothly through all of the gears. The suspension feels very smooth and solid and sits at correct ride height (not sagged out like a lot of 400 series cars). The front end is nice and tight and does not pull or wonder. The car has newer correct factory Michelin TRX tires and rides beautifully. All of the electronics are operating as designed including the pop up headlights, exterior lights, interior lights, power antenna, factory radio, all dash lights and gauges. The power mirrors, windows, locks, AC is cold and the boot and front bonnet release buttons are also functioning. There is absolutely no rust on the car and the undercarriage is all original and untouched. This is a very original and unmolested 400i that is rarely seen in this well maintained original state. Accompanied with the sale of this car are the original Ferrari books in their original Ferrari pouch, the original Ferrari keys, the original jack and spare and a very large file of service records dating back to when the car was new. Thousands of dollars in recent work has been done by a specialist and servicing and repair work has been very consistent. This is an excellent opportunity to acquire a very rare well maintained 400i with an excellent consistent service file and excellent provenance.

This Dino 308 GT4 Series III Model is a no rust, straight, original california car; it runs and drives strong and tight. This Ferrari is current on service and has been well cared for and well maintained.

CA Smog was completed and passed within the last few weeks. The registration is valid until January 2018. Regarding the history of significant work done, both heads were recently rebuilt within the last year. Also, both timing belts and ALL hoses were changed at the same time. The ignition has been upgraded from points to electronic, however both distributors are still in use.
Factory Brakes are in excellent condition with upgraded Pads, Springs and Electronic Ignition and New Battery.  The spare wheel is the stock Dino wheel. The car sits on original wheels a new tires.

Regarding the body, the paint is in great condition. There are some minor flaws on the body, however this car is truly rust free. Finally, this car includes the factory sunroof option which makes this 308 GT4 even more rare than it already is.
Of note:

The rear sub-frame of the vehicle was damaged by the previous owner. After a thorough inspection and consultation, the rear sub-frame was removed and completely replaced with a professionally fabricated competition grade version. The original Ferrari sub-frame design was really not up to today's standards, so rather than replace it we made the decision to have it upgraded.
This car was a daily driver and would make a great mod-restoration for someone who wants to put this classic vehicle to use versus making it a garage queen.
At this time, please email for information and an appointment to see the car.
1975 Ferrari 308 GT4
Silver with Red Leather and Blue Carpet

The 308 GT4 represented many firsts for Ferrari. Powered by Ferrari's first V8  the car started a long tradition that is still alive today. Additionally  it was Ferrari's first mid engined 2+2  and the car was the first and so far only production Ferrari styled by Bertone. The engine was a lovely 3 liter quad cam unit topped by four Weber carburetors  and was mounted transversely. The handsome styling has aged well  and the cars are enjoying a resurgence in interest at the present time  particularly because they are enjoyable cars to drive and are quite usable.
More information on this particular example to follow shortly.
Regretfully selling my
1982 Ferrari Mondial 8 coupe.

One of just 147 US-spec Mondial 8's and in excellent condition. This car appears to have had a restoration within the last decade. It spent the last 6+ years on display in a car museum. I had the car looked over by a seasoned Ferrari mechanic and he was impressed with how well it has been preserved (especially since so many Mondial 8's have rotten away or have been used for parts). The car had a belt service and fluids changed in April of this year. It runs and drives great. The paint is a respray and has some small imperfections at close inspection, as well as some very small dents/dings that paintless dent removal could handle. There are a couple non-stock details like window tint and black painted wheel centers that could be "undone" if it doesn't suit the next owner. The engine bay looks immaculate, and the underbody looks clean. The interior is very clean, and it looks like the black leather was redyed during the restoration. The car spent most of its life on the west coast and I don't see any evidence of rust.
The car has a clean history, and a clean title in hand. I am happy to allow pre-purchase inspections. Photos of the interior are pending as I had trouble getting my camera to cooperate.

This beautiful 308 Dino GT4 just came out of the shop from receiving a complete belt service.Car is ready to drive anywhere.The car shows no indication of accident or rust history.Tires are deep in tread.The run and drive is very strong and tight.Clutch and transmission feel perfect.All glass is good,side windows work perfect.The body panels are straight(review the 50 pictures posted),the body gaps are factory straight.The leather is as nice as pictures reflect.All gauges work as designed,car runs cool with strong oil pressure.Review the pictures posted,if the car has interest,contact me at 615-971-4409.The car is located in the Nashville Tn metro area.Independent inspections are welcomed and encouraged(however the service was just completed).There will be an additional $299 doc fee assessed to final sale price.This and other European collectibles may be reviewed at JPFRAZIER.com
